context: The word 'jätame' is the present tense plural form of the Estonian verb 'jäta', which means to leave, abandon, or give up. In first person plural (me - we), it indicates that the speaker(s) are performing the action of leaving something behind. The base form 'jäta' can be conjugated in different tenses and moods: jäda (infinitive), jätan (I leave), jätad (you leave), jatab (he/she/it leaves), jätame (we leave), jätate (you [plural] leave), jätavad (they leave).
